title: pbuilder-dist segfaults in precise when creating a precise chroot and running apt-get update with ROS and OSRF repositories

content.raw:
Happen in different machines and different jenkins jobs. Does not happen using other distributions. Remove cache information under /var/cache and /var/lib/pbuilder* does not solve the problem. Does not happen when only using one repository, no matter if it is ROS or OSRF.

Could be reproduced on a precise system just running:

```
#!bash

pbuilder-dist precise amd64 create --othermirror='deb http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu precise main|deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu precise main' --keyring /etc/apt/trusted.gpg --debootstrapopts --keyring=/etc/apt/trusted.gpg
```

And the usual error with a segfault:
```

Get:2 http://packages.osrfoundation.org precise/main amd64 Packages [11.6 kB]
Get:3 http://packages.osrfoundation.org precise/main i386 Packages [10.3 kB]
Ign http://packages.osrfoundation.org precise/main TranslationIndex

Ign http://packages.osrfoundation.org precise/main Translation-en

Ign http://archive.ubuntu.com precise InRelease
Hit http://archive.ubuntu.com precise Release.gpg
Hit http://archive.ubuntu.com precise Release
Hit http://archive.ubuntu.com precise/main amd64 Packages

Get:7 http://archive.ubuntu.com precise/universe amd64 Packages [4786 kB]

Ign http://packages.ros.org precise/main TranslationIndex
Ign http://packages.ros.org precise/main Translation-en

Get:15 http://archive.ubuntu.com precise/multiverse TranslationIndex [2676 B]

Fetched 16.3 MB in 21s (771 kB/s)
Reading package lists.../usr/lib/pbuilder/pbuilder-createbuildenv: line 95: 18265 Segmentation fault      $CHROOTEXEC /usr/bin/apt-get -q update
I: unmounting dev/pts filesystem
```
and dmesg displays a segfault:
```
[16175502.063553] apt-get[29402]: segfault at 7f8aadd2a324 ip 00007f8aaf19f640 sp 00007fff07ef6af0 error 6 in libapt-pkg.so.4.12.0[7f8aaf109000+120000]
```

The **workaround** needs a couple of actions:

 * Run the pbuilder-dist from a different distribution than precise. The diff of /usr/bin/pbuilder-dist between distributions precise<->raring does not show anything very relevant to me, but I need to apply the patch and check to be sure. Maybe also libapt-pkg is involved.
 * The pbuilder-dist script need to use ```OTHERMIRROR``` enviroment variable instead of ```--othermirror``` command line argument. The code that handles these two options is different in the pbudiler-dist script.

I tried these two actions separately and all two failed.
